oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Benjamin F. Cheatham's appointment

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Confederate States of America; Confederate States of America -- Army; Cheatham, Benjamin Franklin, 1820-1886; Harris, Isham G. (Isham Green), 1818-1897; Provisional Army of Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Form appointing Benjamin F. Cheatham as second brigadier general is signed by Governor of Tennessee Isham G. Harris.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee -- Adjutant General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cheatham participated in most of the western theater battles, from Belmont against the untested Ulysses S. Grant in 1861 to the Battle of Nashville in 1864. He surrendered to General William Tecumseh Sherman after the Carolinas Campaign in North Carolina in 1865.
